intro: Peronia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf peronia, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in spring, producing small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets. Peronia stricta is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
